meanings.definition: A person who goes out to socialize or engage in activities.
meanings.sent1: The sallier enjoyed meeting new friends at the party.
meanings.sent2: The sallier always attends community events to have fun.
meanings.sent3: The sallier made everyone laugh with their dance moves at the gathering.
meanings.sent4: She was a true sallier, diving into conversations with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The sallier's vibrant personality lit up the room wherever they went.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden attack or incursion.
meanings.sent1: The army decided to sallier forth under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent2: The bandits planned to sallier into the village at midnight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon salliered into the picnic area and stole some snacks.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds salliered across the sky, bringing heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The cat salliered onto the table, surprising everyone with its agility.

meanings.definition: To set out on a journey or trip.
meanings.sent1: The explorers decided to sallier into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent2: They planned to sallier on a road trip across the country.
meanings.sent3: The family eagerly salliered towards their vacation destination.
meanings.sent4: The ship salliered through the rough seas towards the distant island.
meanings.sent5: The hikers salliered up the mountain, excited for the breathtaking view at the top.
